intro: Hibbertia mathinnicola, commonly known as the Mount Wilson hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub with distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hibbertia mathinnicola is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
